summary: Brazil's flag has a green background with a yellow diamond. Inside, a blue circle shows the Southern Cross and other stars. The words "Order and Progress" curve around the stars. It was designed after Brazil became a republic in 1889. The green and yellow colors were kept from the old imperial flag. The stars' positions match the night sky over Rio de Janeiro on a historic date. There are now 27 stars, each representing a Brazilian state.
title: Flag of Brazil
